reviews.review_msg: He's a very good lecturer.  He's at his best when in discussion with students, so speak up in class.  Tests are fair and pretty much exactly what we did in class.

Dr. Mellow is such sweet man and prof. Despite his name, he is not mellow. He is particular and buzzes around class giving you millions of handouts to keep. Often his class consists of looking at the handouts, reading through them and highlighting, underlining and circling instructions. This was fine for in-person, online however, it was very dull.

Dr. Mellow is the most patient professor I have had at SFU. He answers every question we have. Even something he had said in class a lot of times. When you are not able to come to class, he will give you the handout and notes next class. He is the person who is really sweet, please choose the course if he teaches. It is worth.

Very clear explanations, but you don't really learn much. He basically gives you all the answers you need for his midterm and final exam. Very strict on writing, which is odd because linguists are supposed to be descriptivists. Regardless, I am glad that I got to encounter Dean during my undergrad and wish he spoke more about his own work.

I have no idea why such morphologist are so willing to make every of his student a newspaper writer. Course itself is easy, and this professor who is the only authority of morphology at SFU claims that he likes every of his course is a writing course. If you like to teach a W course go teach it, not torturing students by bunch of papers.
What a kind & smart prof. He is not patronizing at all like so many profs are. Clear expectations and consistent marker. Very excited about ling. If anything, could get more specific at times.

Dean's a total sweetheart who really tries to help students. He's really clear on his expectations. You always know what he wants of you. His lectures can be a wee bit boring at times, but he tries so hard you can't really fault him.
Really nice guy, very easy course. I slept through half the classes and ended up with 96%. His exams are very slack, hopefully he toughens them up in the future.
